recipeDescriptionLines.recipeDescriptionLine: Tawa fish fry is a staple food in North Karnataka (Karwar). As the name says, fish is cooked on a pan with less oil than deep frying it. This is one of the common way of cooking fish in most of the households which is everyone's favorite.
Most loved fish in the region especially Karwar are Mackeral (Bangda), King Fish (Surmai), Pomfret, Sardines (Tarle).
It goes well as a side dish with white rice and ambat (coconut curry).

preface: I belong to Konkani family, and this dish has been a regular one most days of the week. Fish lovers don't even need rice for instance. I myself can eat it as a main dish.

procedureSteps.stepDescription: Fish should be washed well and scales should be removed before cutting. Cut fish horizontally to one inch thickness. If you are using whole fish, then make small cuts on both sides.
Make a paste of garlic pods, amchur, red chilly powder, turmeric and salt. Marinate the fish with this paste and keep it aside for minimum 30 mins.

Mix sooji with little salt. Roll the marinated fish in sooji so that it is coated completely and keep it aside. Heat a non-stick pan and add oil. Once oil is heated, add fish. If the sooji coating comes come out a little dab some more sooji over the area.
Cook on a medium flame, for about 4-5 mins. Flip the fish to check if sooji has turned brown, then cook the other side on a low flame for about 6 mins. Eat it when it is still hot.

tips.tipDesc: The marinade can be stored in refrigerator for a week.
If you are frying a whole fish like pomfret, make small cuts on both the sides and apply the marinade on the cuts as well.
